content.raw:
`gzserver` works fine, but the binaries `gazebo` and `gzclient` segfaults,
{{{
$ gzclient
Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 1.2.0
Copyright (C) 2011 Nate Koenig, John Hsu, Andrew Howard, and contributors.
Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org

Msg Waiting for master....
Msg Connected to gazebo master @ http://localhost:11345
Error [RenderEngine.cc:553] Can't open display: :3
Warning [RenderEngine.cc:85] Unable to create X window. Rendering will be disabled
gazeb: cannot connect to X server :3
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
}}}


{{{
$ gazebo
Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 1.2.0
Copyright (C) 2011 Nate Koenig, John Hsu, Andrew Howard, and contributors.
Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org

Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 1.2.0
Copyright (C) 2011 Nate Koenig, John Hsu, Andrew Howard, and contributors.
Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org

Msg Waiting for master.Msg Waiting for master
Msg Connected to gazebo master @ http://localhost:11345
Error [RenderEngine.cc:553] Can't open display: :3
Warning [RenderEngine.cc:85] Unable to create X window. Rendering will be disabled

Msg Connected to gazebo master @ http://localhost:11345
Error [RenderEngine.cc:553] Can't open display: :3
Warning [RenderEngine.cc:85] Unable to create X window. Rendering will be disabled
gazeb: cannot connect to X server :3
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
}}}
